priorVersion.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TESTCD

self.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

classVariables.description: Short character value for --TEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: "PLAT", "SYSBP", "RRMIN", "EYEEXAM".
classVariables.label: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
classVariables.name: --TESTCD

priorVersion.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TEST

self.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

classVariables.description: Long name For --TESTCD. Examples: "Platelets", "Systolic Blood Pressure", "Summary (Min) RR Duration", "Eye Examination".
classVariables.label: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
classVariables.name: --TEST

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MODIFY

classVariables.description: If the value of --ORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
classVariables.label: Modified Term
classVariables.name: --MODIFY

qualifiesVariables.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTDTL

classVariables.description: Further description of --TESTCD and --TEST. Example: "The percentage of cells with +1 intensity of staining" when MITEST="Thyroid Transcription Factor 1".
classVariables.label: Measurement, Test, or Examination Detail
classVariables.name: --TSTDTL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CAT

classVariables.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "HEMATOLOGY", "URINALYSIS", "CHEMISTRY", "HAMD 17", "SF36 V2.0 ACUTE", "EGFR MUTATION ANALYSIS".
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SCAT

classVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values. Example: "WBC DIFFERENTIAL".
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--POS

classVariables.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
classVariables.label: Position of Subject During Observation
classVariables.name: --POS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BODSYS

classVariables.description: Body System or Organ Class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results. Example: MedDRA SOC.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
classVariables.name: --BODSYS

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

classVariables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1", "POS".
classVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORRES

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units
Reference Result in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORRESU

classVariables.description: Unit for --ORRES and --ORREF. Examples: "in", "LB", "kg/L".
classVariables.label: Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORRESU

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORNRLO

classVariables.description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.
classVariables.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORNRLO

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORNRHI

classVariables.description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.
classVariables.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORNRHI

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORREF

classVariables.description: Reference value for the result or finding as originally received or collected. --ORREF uses the same units as --ORRES, if applicable. Examples: value from predicted normal value in spirometry tests.
classVariables.label: Reference Result in Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORREF

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

classVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from --ORRES in a standard format or in standard units. --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".
classVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
classVariables.name: --STRESC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STRESN

classVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
classVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STRESN

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format
Reference Result in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STRESU

classVariables.description: Standardized units used for --STRESC, --STRESN, --STREFC, and --STREFN. Example: "mol/L".
classVariables.label: Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STRESU
classVariables.roleDescription: Variable Qualifier of --STRESC and --STRESN and --STREFC and --STREFN

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STNRLO

classVariables.description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).
classVariables.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STNRLO

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STNRHI

classVariables.description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).
classVariables.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STNRHI

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STNRC

classVariables.description: Normal range or reference range for results stored in --STRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: "Negative to Trace".
classVariables.label: Normal Range for Character Results
classVariables.name: --STNRC

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STREFC

classVariables.description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from --ORREF in a standard format.
classVariables.label: Reference Result in Standard Format
classVariables.name: --STREFC

priorVersion.title: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STREFN

self.title: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units

classVariables.description: Reference value for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format or in standard units. --STREFN uses the same units as --STRESN, if applicable.
classVariables.label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
classVariables.name: --STREFN

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--NRIND

classVariables.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by --ORNRLO and --ORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N"; "HIGH", "LOW"; "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL".
classVariables.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
classVariables.name: --NRIND

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RESCAT

classVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Example: "MALIGNANT" or "BENIGN" for tumor findings.
classVariables.label: Result Category
classVariables.name: --RESCAT

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CHRON

classVariables.description: Characterization of the duration of a biological process resulting in a particular finding. Examples: "ACUTE", "CHRONIC", "SUBACUTE".
classVariables.label: Chronicity of Finding
classVariables.name: --CHRON

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DISTR

classVariables.description: Description of the distribution pattern of a finding within the examined area. Examples: "FOCAL", "MULTIFOCAL", "DIFFUSE", "FOCAL", "MULTIFOCAL".
classVariables.label: Distribution Pattern of Finding
classVariables.name: --DISTR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RESLOC

classVariables.description: Location where the result was observed (as opposed to the location specified for examination). This location may have a higher degree of specificity than the location specified for examination. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Result Location of Finding
classVariables.name: --RESLOC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STAT

classVariables.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASND

classVariables.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is "NOT DONE".
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--XFN

classVariables.description: Filename for an external file, such as one for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariables.label: External File Path
classVariables.name: --XFN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--NAM

classVariables.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
classVariables.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
classVariables.name: --NAM

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LOINC

classVariables.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test.
classVariables.label: LOINC Code
classVariables.name: --LOINC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPEC

classVariables.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE", "DNA", "RNA".
classVariables.label: Specimen Material Type
classVariables.name: --SPEC

qualifiesVariables.title: Specimen Material Type

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ANTREG

classVariables.description: Defines the specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen or the region from which the specimen is obtained, as defined in the protocol, such as a section or part of what is described in the --SPEC variable. Examples: "CORTEX", "MEDULLA", "MUCOSA".
classVariables.label: Anatomical Region
classVariables.name: --ANTREG

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPCCND

classVariables.description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: "CLOUDY".
classVariables.label: Specimen Condition
classVariables.name: --SPCCND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPCUFL

classVariables.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.
classVariables.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
classVariables.name: --SPCUFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LOC

classVariables.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "RECTAL" for temperature, "ARM" for blood pressure.
classVariables.label: Location Used for the Measurement
classVariables.name: --LOC

qualifiesVariables.title: Location Used for the Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LAT

classVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
classVariables.label: Laterality
classVariables.name: --LAT

qualifiesVariables.title: Location Used for the Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DIR

classVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
classVariables.label: Directionality
classVariables.name: --DIR

qualifiesVariables.title: Location Used for the Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--PORTOT

classVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement or apportioning of. Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MANY".
classVariables.label: Portion or Totality
classVariables.name: --PORTOT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--METHOD

classVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EIA" (enzyme immunoassay), "ELECTROPHORESIS", "DIPSTICK".
classVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
classVariables.name: --METHOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RUNID

classVariables.description: A unique identifier for a particular run of a test on a particular batch of samples.
classVariables.label: Run ID
classVariables.name: --RUNID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ANMETH

classVariables.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., an image or a genetic sequence).
classVariables.label: Analysis Method
classVariables.name: --ANMETH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LEAD

classVariables.description: Lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument. Examples: "LEAD I", "LEAD V2", "LEAD CM5".
classVariables.label: Lead Identified to Collect Measurements
classVariables.name: --LEAD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CSTATE

classVariables.description: The consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement. Examples: "CONSCIOUS", "SEMI-CONSCIOUS", "UNCONSCIOUS".
classVariables.label: Consciousness State
classVariables.name: --CSTATE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LOBXFL

classVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
classVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
classVariables.name: --LOBXFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BLFL

classVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null.
classVariables.label: Baseline Flag
classVariables.name: --BLFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--FAST

classVariables.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.
classVariables.label: Fasting Status
classVariables.name: --FAST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DRVFL

classVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
classVariables.label: Derived Flag
classVariables.name: --DRVFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EVAL

classVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
classVariables.label: Evaluator
classVariables.name: --EVAL

qualifiesVariables.title: Evaluator

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EVALID

classVariables.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".
classVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
classVariables.name: --EVALID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ACPTFL

classVariables.description: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted evaluation. Expected values can include "Y", "N", or null. This is not intended to be an analysis flag to indicate acceptability for a given analysis.
classVariables.label: Accepted Record Flag
classVariables.name: --ACPTFL

qualifiesVariables.title: Toxicity Grade

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TOX

classVariables.description: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: "HYPERCALCEMIA", "HYPOCALCEMIA". Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.
classVariables.label: Toxicity
classVariables.name: --TOX

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TOXGR

classVariables.description: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define data definition document. Example: "2".
classVariables.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariables.name: --TOXGR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SEV

classVariables.description: Describes the severity or intensity of a particular finding. Examples: "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE".
classVariables.label: Severity
classVariables.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DTHREL

classVariables.description: Describes the relationship of a particular finding to the death of a subject. Examples: "Y", "N", or "U". Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Relationship to Death
classVariables.name: --DTHREL

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LLOQ

classVariables.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for --STRESU.
classVariables.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
classVariables.name: --LLOQ

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ULOQ

classVariables.description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for --STRESU.
classVariables.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
classVariables.name: --ULOQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EXCLFL

classVariables.description: Indicates whether the values in the result variables for this record should be excluded from summary statistical calculations such as Mean, Standard Deviation, and Count (and others). Expected to be "Y" or null. --EXCLFL should not be used when --STAT is "NOT DONE". Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Exclude from Statistics
classVariables.name: --EXCLFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASEX

classVariables.description: Reason excluded from statistics. Used in conjunction with --EXCLFL when its value is "Y". Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion from Statistics
classVariables.name: --REASEX

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--USCHFL

classVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of a performed test or observation was unscheduled. If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. Not to be used with human clinical trials. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.
classVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariables.name: --USCHFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REPNUM

classVariables.description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point or within a visit). For example, multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.
classVariables.label: Repetition Number
classVariables.name: --REPNUM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RSTIND

classVariables.description: An indicator as to whether the animal was restrained during the observation period. Expected values are "Y" or null. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Restraint Indicator
classVariables.name: --RSTIND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RSTMOD

classVariables.description: A description of whether the restraint was physical and/or chemical. Not to be used with human clinical trials.
classVariables.label: Restraint Mode
classVariables.name: --RSTMOD

description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2018-06-29)
label: Findings Observation Class
name: Findings
